title.native: 装甲騎兵ボトムズ　レッドショルダードキュメント野望のルーツ
title.romaji: Soukou Kihei Votoms: Red Shoulder Document - Yabou no Roots
title.english: Armored Trooper Votoms: Origin of Ambition

description:
After armored trooper pilot Chirico Cuvie is given orders to transfer to Planet Odon, he and all of the other new recruits are sent into a simulated battle to test their abilities. However, this 'simulated battle' turns out to be a serious fight to eliminate those without the necessary skills. Chirico survives along with just three others, despite the fact that he fought while injured. It soon becomes apparent that this is not the first time he has survived against incredible odds, a fact that Colonel Peruzen wishes to exploit. But is Chirico truly immortal?

(Source: Anime-Planet)
synonyms: Armored Trooper Votoms: Red Shoulder Document - Yabo no Roots
Armored Trooper Votoms: The Red Shoulder Document - Roots of Ambition

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

title.native: 装甲騎兵ボトムズ ペールゼン・ファイルズ

node.description:
[Website](http://www.yatate.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yatate_hajime) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/矢立肇) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hajime_Yatate)

Hajime Yatate is a collective pseudonym for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s staff.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/高橋良輔_(アニメ監督%29)

Originally from [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/). He is one of [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most influential figures, pioneering and evolving the "real robot" genre of anime with shows such as [Taiyou no Kiba Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/) and [Soukou Kihei Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/).

Originating from [Tatsunoko Production](https://anilist.co/studio/103/).
Kunio Okawara was the first in the industry to be specifically credited as a mechanical designer. He is the designer of numerous Real Robots and Super Robots.

Perhaps most well known for his work as a character designer on the anime television series [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/). He was also one of the founding members of [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/), together with [Kouichi Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/191548/), [Kazuo Komatsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/129558/), and Koushin Yonekawa.

In 1966, Shioyama joined Hatena Pro under the direction of [Bonjin Nagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/117141/). Shioyama later became a freelancer, doing work for [Tatsunoko Pro](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) and working on many projects for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as an animation director. Shioyama's first project as a character designer was for [Invincible Steel Man Daitarn 3](https://anilist.co/anime/3305/), which anime director [Ryousuke Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100957/) praised. He then worked on such shows as [Fang of the Sun Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/), [Panzer World Galient](https://anilist.co/anime/5153/), and [Ronin Warriors](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) as both character designer and animation director. His and Takahashi's designs epitomized Sunrise's work in the '80s.

On April 13, 2017, a fire occurred at Shioyama's apartment in Misato, sadly killing both him and his wife.

Perhaps most well known for his work as a character designer on the anime television series [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/). He was also one of the founding members of [Oh! Production](https://anilist.co/studio/234/), together with [Kouichi Murata](https://anilist.co/staff/191548/), [Kazuo Komatsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/129558/), and Koushin Yonekawa.

In 1966, Shioyama joined Hatena Pro under the direction of [Bonjin Nagaki](https://anilist.co/staff/117141/). Shioyama later became a freelancer, doing work for [Tatsunoko Pro](https://anilist.co/studio/103/) and working on many projects for [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as an animation director. Shioyama's first project as a character designer was for [Invincible Steel Man Daitarn 3](https://anilist.co/anime/3305/), which anime director [Ryousuke Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100957/) praised. He then worked on such shows as [Fang of the Sun Dougram](https://anilist.co/anime/2257/), [Panzer World Galient](https://anilist.co/anime/5153/), and [Ronin Warriors](https://anilist.co/anime/1264/) as both character designer and animation director. His and Takahashi's designs epitomized Sunrise's work in the '80s.

On April 13, 2017, a fire occurred at Shioyama's apartment in Misato, sadly killing both him and his wife.

__Graduated:__ Tokyo Zokei University

Takizawa Toshifumi was a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

After he graduated Tokyo Zokei University, he got to work at Tokyo Animation Film, where he worked as part of a photography team. In later years he started working for Shin-Ei Douga, where he was a production assistant. After he started working at Nippon Sunrise, he became a director, giving his debut in 1985 with the Dirty Pair TV series. He continued working as a director afterwards, but as a freelancer instead.

He was a line director on the Ideon Be Invoked film, he was also involved in the Votoms series and has directed Gonzo's TV adaption of Kurosawa's epic Samurai 7 film, which he did in 2004.

Toshifumi passed away on June 22, 2015 from esophageal cancer. He was 61 years old when he died, and up until that point he would still be doing his ordinary activities like driving his car and walking his dog.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/浦上靖夫)

Founder of [Audio Planning U](https://anilist.co/studio/6561/), and the father of [Keiko](https://anilist.co/staff/162367/) and [Yasuyuki Urakami](https://anilist.co/staff/144509/).

In 2016, he received an Honorary Achievement Award for his role as a sound director in [Detective Conan](https://anilist.co/anime/235/).
